pkgmetadata.longdescription: from odictliteral import odict==============================Provides a nice way of specifying ordered dictionaries from Python source.Example: >>> from odictliteral import odict >>> x = odict[1:2,3:4] >>> print(x) odict[1: 2, 3: 4]You can use odict as a replacement for OrderedDict otherwise, eg: >>> y = odict( [(1,2), (3,4)] ) >>> print(y) odict[1: 2, 3: 4] >>> x == y TrueYou should also be able to use odict in combination with OrderedDicts: >>> z = OrderedDict( [(1,2), (3,4)] ) >>> print(z) OrderedDict([(1, 2), (3, 4)]) >>> y == z TrueThat's pretty much all there is to it. Should be compatible with Python2.7 and Python 3; requires the "ordereddict" module to work with Python2.4, 2.5 or 2.6.
